result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John G Nash

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John G Nash not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for John G Nash.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Letter from Defendant addressed to the Court.

Defendant John G Nash not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for John G Nash.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant John G Nash not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John G Nash in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant John G Nash in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective R. Martinez. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant John G Nash not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to a medical emergency the defendant is unable to appear for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, appear by video. Defendant John G Nash not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witnss present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Robert Hampton

Court ordered no contact with Metro Market and their employees.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant John G Nash in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant John G Nash in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
